website_summaries.verdict: The plush petals on these adorable flowers add a touch of luxury to bathing in the sink. Convenient for moms and oh so comfortable for babies.
pros: Soft, padded petals cradle babies on a cloud of comfort so carers can focus more on actually washing tots than holding them
Petals can be arranged in just about any sink to support even smaller babies
Washer and dryer safe on delicate cycle
cons: It absorbs a lot of water and wringing it out after bath time can be a hassle

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for pets!
customer_reviews.text: I saw this item and immediately thought of my 18+ year old Pug. He loves baths but because he's an older dog he slips a lot when I bathe him so I have to hold him with one arm and bathe him with the other. I thought I'd give this item a try and it worked perfectly. He just loved it. He was so comfortable as he leaned into it while the tap was running over him. It made bathing him so much easier for me as well. I highly recommend this for pets, especially seniors. It's very kind to their old bones.
customer_reviews.author: Alaina M Denino

customer_reviews.title: Must have when bathing your baby!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I wish I would have bought it sooner instead of when my babe was 5 month old . I am able to bath her unassisted where as I had to have another person help me when using a traditional baby bath. Bonus, no more crouching over and breaking my back to bath my babe in the bathtub. Only thing that is annoying sometimes is that the bloom slides around sometimes in the sink. Super easy to adjust and move the bloom back to its original position.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Howell

customer_reviews.title: I really like that this gives my baby more support and makes ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like that this gives my baby more support and makes it easier to bathe her at the littlest of little stages. The only drawback, and I wish I had known this before I bought it, is that it takes half an eternity to dry. Just be prepared to wring it out for all you're worth, then hang it up, and for it to be damp dry 48 hours later. Not saying I wouldn't buy it again, but that is a bit inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Rothlauren C. Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This item should be a must for all baby registries. This is our sixth child and we have done everything from the infant tub to the net lounge seat ..this is by far the most amazing bathing item.. our son gets in it and instantly relaxes, it is so soft he just sinks into it. we can use it in the smallest sink in our bathroom to the biggest sink in our kitchen! absolutely the best purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Bath Saver! & Pool Fun!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only way our preemie baby would allow us to bathe her! It also frees up hands so you can get business done faster and get babe warm and dry faster which is a plus. Also used in a rubbermade container with some warm water as a little pool when we went swimming and didn't want to place her in chlorinated water. She loved splashing around on a hot day. I'll buy this for all my pregnant friends!
customer_reviews.author: V. Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best baby bath for the sink. I used it twice so far in my kitchen sink. My baby seems very comfortable in it and I am not afraid that my baby will hit her head. She is now one month old.
customer_reviews.author: Char Mom

customer_reviews.title: I did not like this product
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this product. The flower petals can slide apart & baby’s head ends up slipping in between them to the cold, hard sink. Also, it’s not as easy to clean if you’re baby decides to poo as soon as you put her in 😧
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our kitchen sink was a little big for it but it was fine for what we needed
customer_reviews.text: We have used this since he was a month old. Our kitchen sink was a little big for it but it was fine for what we needed. He is 1 month in the first photo and 4 months in the second photo. He is comfortable when using it:) it washes and dries well. I don't have any complaints!
customer_reviews.author: PAJ2336

customer_reviews.title: you have to have a good system of drying it
customer_reviews.text: Bought a grey one. It’s cute but every time you use it, you have to have a good system of drying it. I would put it inside the dryer for about an hour to get it completely dry. When I was back from maternity leave, my mom used it 5 days a week to give my baby a bath and would just hang if over the sink and it has gotten very stinky by the end of the week.
customer_reviews.author: Rowena Similar

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this! You have to work a little extra to get in all those little fat rolls since it keeps the baby scrunched up but my baby seems very content and happy during bath time. It’s super soft but also pretty absorbent. I put it outside after using it and it drys well, but I’m in a very dry climate. I’m not sure how it would do in a more humid area. You’d have to put it in the dryer after every use to prevent mold. I wash it in the washing machine after every few uses and it’s holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Petra A.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, but not useful
customer_reviews.text: This baby bathtub sink insert is beautiful. But I had a really difficult time using it. I tried it in the kitchen sink (standard stainless steel double sink) where it wanted to fold itself around the baby. The photo shows a baby sitting in it with an adult hand close by... however, I was unable to take my hand off the baby. I had to support his back and simultaneously hold some of the "petals" down. So I tried it in my bathroom sink, which is shallower and smaller than the kitchen sink. The flower wouldn't fold hardly at all. It kept wanting to straighten out, even with the baby sitting on it.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Franklin

customer_reviews.title: This is adorable, it is a excellent concept
customer_reviews.text: This is adorable, it is a excellent concept, but way to big and bulky. It is EXTREMELY hard to get dry, and very easy to develop hold. It is now just used my bathroom as a wall decoration. But is a pain to dry, and it is so bulky to try and fit in a average sink. My baby wasn't smiling, when I put him in it. This is not something I would purchase again. I find it to be a huge waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Cheshire

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings, but happy overall!!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s thinner than I expected and way bigger. When I got it out of the box I immediately thought it wouldn’t fit any of the sinks in our home. However, I tried and it adapts perfectly to any shape, which was surprising to me. The material at first seems cheap to touch, but as you familiarize with it you can tell it’s very resisting and long lasting (I hope). Also, it seems very easy to clean. Fabulous to move around with, it’s not heavy AT ALL. I know it’ll be super easy to travel with. I’m still unsure as to how to store it when I’m not using it, since it’s quite large, but am happy overall with the outcome.
customer_reviews.author: BazantSol

customer_reviews.title: It is a super cute design but not really useful
customer_reviews.text: It is a super cute design but not really useful. The flower doesn't stay put, slides around the sink and floats up. If your LO moves and plays during bath time I would not recommend this product at all. Also it is a must to clean and dry the flower after every use or it will get a mild moldy smell.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Not great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Wash often dry in dryer after each use. Noticed moldy mildew on back of flower center. Dry climate! Hard to wring out to get to dryer. Not great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dawna

customer_reviews.title: Lots of padding is a blessing and a curse.
customer_reviews.text: I love how padded this is compared with other "tubs" but I do have 2 complaints about it. 1- because it absorbs the water in the sink and is so think, it gets cold really fast. I have to alternate between washing my baby and adding more warm water to the "petals". It's not a huge problem, just really inconvenient since 1 hand is always on baby and I feel like I use more water than I should be needed. 2- the petals are thick and absorbent which means when you're all done with bath time, you have a soaking wet and heavy mat to deal with. Not something you can tackle one handed.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Nice and it works, but cleanup not easy
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought this and she likes it in general. But cleanup it is not easy when you have a #2 accident while washing the little one. Than you have to take it from sink full with water, dripping all over and put it in the washer which is on a different floor. I'm looking for a simpler, easier solution.... Even without accidents it takes a long time for it to dry and you need a large space on in the bath tub hanging into something for it to dry. Always looking to make the job of being a new dad easier... :)
customer_reviews.author: Alex Secerator

customer_reviews.title: Essential for new parents!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases I’ve made for my newborn. She loves it! It’s so easy to accommodate and to clean! My daughter loves to have baths thanks to this flower! She enjoys the fluffiness and comfort. When it comes to clean it, it’s so easy to just put inside your dryer and have it ready for your next bath. you can also wash it or if you have stains some oxyclean and hot water will do the trick. Also, a lot of people were complaining about the weight of it once it’s wet. I didn’t find it THAT heavy, but I use a tiny bucket anyways to take it to my dryer and would recommend the same to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: The Prescotts

customer_reviews.title: Best Baby Bath Ever
customer_reviews.text: I have used this baby bath for all 3 of my kids, and bought this one for my friend's baby shower. This is by far the easiest and most comfortable way to bathe an infant. I have used it in the kitchen sink, and then on the bathtub base as a cushion. It is soft and thick enough to provide some support for the baby, and because it is made out of a towel like material, baby doesn't slide around during bath time! Easy to wash and dry. Will continue to use for all baby baths I give.
customer_reviews.author: knelson17

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not the best choice
customer_reviews.text: I thought these were adorable so I really wanted one for my son. It fits nicely in our bathroom sinks but is a bit small for my kitchen sink. It is soft and folds easily. Machine washable which is great because you will need to wash it often as it doesn't dry out well and will smell. I only used this for the first two months because then my son outgrew the bathroom sinks! It's cute but it isn't really the best option on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this.:
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this bath, but I just couldn’t. I felt the water was way hard to squeeze out. I would end up having to put it on a rinse cycle in my washing machine and then in the dryer. Like oh no, way too much work and just not worth it. Granted the baby was cute in this though. Not for me.
customer_reviews.author: CareBeaubi

customer_reviews.title: Bright Beautiful well made !!!
customer_reviews.text: This is soooonice! Quality is amazing and the soap just rinsed right off! Worth every penny. Also my baby is 5 months old and too big for baby tub and to small for sitting up in sink and I love sink bathing. I gave her a bath in this seat and she screamed with joy for at least 25 minutes it was hysterical. She loved the freedom of this flower cushion. She was able to almost sit up and splash she was sooo happy! Thank you for an amazing cushion that’s keeps sink baths fun and safe!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley  Pastore

customer_reviews.title: My infant granddaughter loved her "spa" time when she would stay over at ...
customer_reviews.text: My infant granddaughter loved her "spa" time when she would stay over at grandma's house. The cushion seemed adequate for her comfort. I read reviews from others that couldn't completely dry them. My husband would squeeze as much water as he could, placed it in the washer in the spinning cycle, then put it in the dryer and didn't have the damp issue.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: I DONT RECOMMEND IT FOR ANY BABY UNDER 6 MONTHS OLD
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS A BULKY DISASTER FOR INFANT BATHING, I DONT RECOMMEND IT FOR ANY BABY UNDER 6 MONTHS OLD, AND ITS REALLY HARD TO GET TO DRY.
customer_reviews.author: The Cool Pearl Lady

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to leave a negative review for something I did not like. To be fair I misread the information and thought this would work in a bath tub but it's made for the sink. I live in a small apartment and don't have a sink big enough for this tub. I'm in the process of the returning this item and so far the return process has gone smoothly. I'm really bummed I don't get to use this tub because I like have the fabric feels and I think it's really cute. Therefore I give this item 5 stars because of fast shipping, good quality, good customer service, and perfect item description.
customer_reviews.author: lhcummins

customer_reviews.title: Wish it gripped better and dried faster
customer_reviews.text: I love this for bathing our baby in our large sink, but because we have a single-bowl 30" sink it doesn't fill the whole space and it slides pretty easily. I wish the bottom gripped better. It also takes forever to dry--we put in the dryer on low and it usually takes two cycles. I worry about letting it air dry for fear of the foam growing mold.
customer_reviews.author: PageTurner

customer_reviews.title: comfy foofy bath flower cushion- worth splurging on
customer_reviews.text: I always thought of this as one of those weird unnecessary, luxury baby items & never even registered for it. Finally bought one for our 4th baby.... & definitely wish I had it with the others. It looks super comfy & my daughter loves relaxing in the water with this. Fits great in our sink to keep her in place & not sliding around like the old cheapie piece of foam I used with my last 2 babies. I’m sure will work well with our giant baby/toddler tub when she’s older to make it extra comfy. This is now absolutely on my list of baby products worth the splurge that I will recommend to other moms.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Better for older babies
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my baby when she was only a couple months old. I absolutely hated it. I threw it in a closet and forgot about it. I pulled it out again once my baby was almost a year old and I love it now! It’s so hard to keep a smaller baby upright and bathe them in this flower, it’s so much easier when they have better head/body control. Make sure you wash it after every use. It gets moldy quickly. Hang drying doesn’t really cut it. I wash mine in the washer with laundry sanitizer (Lysol, it’s amazing!) and the flower is fresh and I’m comfortable putting my daughter in it.
customer_reviews.author: Sb1983Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: worth it!
customer_reviews.text: this is one of my top purchases for my baby!! the plastic tub made us uncomfortable for how hard it was and how tiny he was. we purchased this to use in our double kitchen sink and its been fantastic! my husband laughed at me at first but after seeing how well it works out he agrees it was totally worth it and one of our best purchases! highly recommend!! (that being said- my little one is almost 3 months and starting to get a little too big for it. he's 12lbs 5oz, 23in
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love This Cute Flower!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using my Blooming Bath since June. I love how cute and comfortable my baby looks in it when I give her her bath in the sink. I know some people complained of mildew? But I don’t have that problem. After every bath, I squeeze out as much of the water as I can and hang it in my shower to air dry. And I put it through the wash after about 3 uses. The dryer doesn’t ruin it either. It comes out as fluffy and soft as it was when I first got it. So it’s all about upkeep and just enjoying your little one looking like a Cabbage Patch Kid in it. ☺️
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Hester

customer_reviews.title: Lovely flower
customer_reviews.text: This thing saves my baby's little wiggling noggin!! It's super soft and keeps her super comfortable! I just wish it was a wee bit bigger. I have a fairly big sink and have to prop a Tupperware in the nook in my sink. In the photo this was the best possible position that kept her propped up.
customer_reviews.author: Shelbie Garcia

customer_reviews.title: MOLDY!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product almost daily for 6 months. I wring it out and hang it up to dry after each use and wash and dry weekly with bleach and it is full of MOLD! I shudder to think of how long I've been bathing my baby in mild! Yuck!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: over all great buy
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it twice for my 7 month old. Using the sling in the tub was too back breaking and she's too slippery to hold up in the sink as she doesn't quite sit up on her own yet. This works great in the kitchen sink. Helps my back and keeps her comfortably propped up in sink so I can wash her with both hands. I've been wringing it out the best I can then putting in washer for a rinse/drain cycle, then into dryer. Seems to hold up in washer and dryer well. Hopefully mildew/mold won't be an issue later on.
customer_reviews.author: sreyes

customer_reviews.title: Go for it
customer_reviews.text: Honesty I see the flower shape and think stupid, but its so effective lol. Im sure my 6 year old and wife like the flower shape though. We used a plastic tub for our first daugter and it was a nightmare. This is way easier to pop into a sink and feels so much safer, without the whole slip and drop fears of other methods.
customer_reviews.author: William Hammock

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: It was an absolute nightmare to give our 2 week old a bath in the baby tub. He would scream the whole entire time! After a couple of these traumatic experiences, we decided to invest in blooming bath. He was a different baby when we used this! He was calm and so relaxed that he eventually fell asleep in this! It was so easy to clean it later, you just throw it in the washer. It dries well in the dryer on gentle setting too. I highly recommend this to anyone who is looking for a cozy happy bath time for their baby.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Finally something cute and easy to store for baby baths!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing for our newborn daughter. She was a premie and super small even when it was ready for bath time. The flower fit perfectly in the sink and we are able to move around the petals to insure nothing short of a comfy bath for her! No plug needed as the flower takes care of that. A shift of a petal allows to drain throughout bath when sink fills up! We ring out in sink and hang on clothes line/shower rod to dry. Washed in machine with no damage also. Would highly recommend to all! Would make a perfect gift to new parents also!
customer_reviews.author: Natosha

customer_reviews.title: I love that my baby can just relax in the sink
customer_reviews.text: I really love this and the main reason I dont use it more it I just find it easier to shower with my daughter to get her cleaned quick. That being said when I do use it I love that my daughter can just lay in the water for a little bit and enjoy the warmth. It's an awkward shape and we honestly just ring it out, lay it over the bath tub and throw it in with the laundry the next day after every use. It dosnt dry out the best and we do not use it too often so washing every time works fine and it stays nice and soft.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great if you're using it in the desert.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for some friends in Dubai. They loved it. They did not have a mold or mildew problem; probably because they dried it on their balcony, and that dry Dubai heat never gave the molds and mildews a chance. I can totally see it being a problem if you live in ahumid climate.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Best baby purchase we made!
customer_reviews.text: We give our son a bath in this at LEAST once a day - sometimes two or three times since he has reflux which can get prettttyyyy messy. We had a baby bath for the tub, but it kept hurting my back to keep bending over, so I bought this for our kitchen sink. SO WORTH IT. My son now looooves bathtime, and it's easy enough for me to throw it in the washing machine every night. I was hesitant to purchase because other reviewers had commented it grew mold easily, but since we wash it every day I think we may be able to avoid that problem before he outgrows it.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: I really like the idea of this
customer_reviews.text: I really like the idea of this, however, I didn’t find this to be great for our newborn. Yet, as he has gotten older and developed more head control it is easier to use. I think it was be perfect once he can sit unassisted. We have granite countertops and I have just been afraid that he will fall in between the petals and hit his head. The material is very soft and comfortable for baby. I also love that I can put it in the washing machine and dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Jessi S

customer_reviews.title: Not sure...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter since as a second time mom those typical hammock over top of the plastic tub option annoyed me so much with my son's neck position. This does not work well with newborns at all. I used it to give her her first bath and there is absolutely no support at all so I had to use one hand to hold her and the other to awkwardly wash while trying to support her. She is 3 months now and it has gotten a bit easier. Once she can sit up on her own it will be perfect. Easy to clean and take with you anywhere that has big enough sink.
customer_reviews.author: Genny

customer_reviews.title: Supports slippery young babies
customer_reviews.text: Great for newborns to 6 months. I used it in my sink. The petals can be arranged to support infants so you can wash them without their slipping down. Used until they can sit on their own
customer_reviews.author: Beth Shully

customer_reviews.title: We love this... but
customer_reviews.text: Great buy! Super easy while baby is a new born. Rather than getting out our little tub... The fabric catches lint and turned blue from jeans that have been washed countless times. Wouldn’t say it’s “awesome” for travel only because of how much water it holds. Just ring it out well and hang to dry if on the go otherwise use a dryer if available. Flower has nice tag on back that we stick a hanger through and hang in our laundry room.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie Kerg

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay in place
customer_reviews.text: Cute design, but slips in sink or tub when wet , no way to anchor it in place. Since it absorbs water, the petals become cool during bath Also need to consider how you will hang it to let it dry, as it is quite heavy when wet . I squeeze it as much as possible then let it hang on a hook over the sink until i can squeeze more water out , then I toss it in a dryer with a towel because I imagine a wet spongey thing like this will get smelly if left wet continually
customer_reviews.author: sue dee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for even Preemie Babies
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter. She had twin, preemie newborns. Trying to bath them in any type of tub (since they were under 4 lbs) was difficult. Until I found this, she had been giving them sponge baths. This bath allowed them to be propped up a bit, on their own, in the sink and was cushiony soft all around them. This freed up her hands to actually be able to bathe them properly. Both babies seem to really like it. There is no upset or fussing at bath time. They nestle in and just enjoy looking around as Mom bathes them.
customer_reviews.author: Trishalovetoo

customer_reviews.title: Yes, yes, yes!
customer_reviews.text: I love my blooming bath lotus! Super soft, plush, and cute! Honestly... I use it for my dogs. I've got toy breeds that make it difficult to put in the bath tub, so a comfy sink for them is much more enjoyable for both of us! I'd buy another one when babies enter the picture :).
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: So this thing is freaking awesome! My 6 week old son (though too young to "love" anything) is very comfy and cozy in the lotus during bath time. I feel like he's very well supported during bathtime and he likes to sit up straight. One very important note: you MUST wash and dry this thing after every single bath. There can be no exceptions. It's a thick foam which WILL trap moisture and grow mildew if you don't.
customer_reviews.author: Mominator

customer_reviews.title: The idea is there but isn't ready for prime time
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product. However, it is too bulky. Aside from the kitchen sink, you really can't use it anywhere due to its bulkiness. We tried using it inside a large plastic baby pool and it helped a little. It also soaked in a lot of water making it hard to carry and clean. End result, returned and bought a regular infant tub and it was much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Tri Le

customer_reviews.title: I loved this when I saw it online and my baby ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved this when I saw it online and my baby does love getting a bath because it's so soft and cuddly but the only complaint comes from clean up process. I followed the instructions after use and hung to dry then placed in dryer to finish drying each time and after only 4 uses I found black spots of mold. I will be returning this product and getting a standard bathtub after this. 😔
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Leigh Keith

customer_reviews.title: Great for baby!
customer_reviews.text: Love this for small babies. I put it inside a baby tub and it is easy for them to lie down without sliding around. Keeps them warm and comfortable. I read reviews before buying and some said it would get smelly or hard to clean. It's machine washable and I wash and tumble dry after 1or 2 uses. It's been perfect. Bought mine a year ago and this one as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: JHarker

customer_reviews.title: Fits great in smaller sinks!
customer_reviews.text: Just got it in the mail and put it in our sink right away! I was scared it wasn’t going to fit in our bathroom sink because it’s pretty small and shallow, but it’s perfect! Can’t wait to use it when baby girl arrives next month😍 will post another update after we use it but I can already tell we’re going to love it!
customer_reviews.author: BCA

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This is so soft for you to use, the petals make it comfortable for my daughter in bath time and she loves it. Couple things, you need to soak each petal completely or it floats around making it difficult to bathe baby. When you’re finished you need to wring out each petal to get the water out; it holds a lot of water so you need to hang it up to dry as well when finished. I hang mine up to dry in the spare bathroom tub so the water drips into it. However though, I think that little “inconvenience” is worth it. Even then it’s not that big of a deal. It makes bathing baby by yourself easy.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Save your money, buy the baby bath tub
customer_reviews.text: We have a big sink and this would move around all over the place. It was honestly unnecessary. It made us (new parents) even more nervous bc it moved so much and it was a hassle to wring out and dry. We ended up buying a bath tub with an insert for infants. Although this petal is cute, it’s not functional. Save your money and buy a bath tub with an infant insert that can grow with your child until they’re ready to be on the adult bath tub.
customer_reviews.author: Lindy

customer_reviews.title: Go to Baby Shower Gift!
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a gift at my own baby shower & loved it so much it is now my go-to for friends showers! This made it possible for me to wash my baby in the sink by myself. I was able to set him down without worrying about him slipping or hitting his head. Super easy to rinse & clean, then I just throw it in the dryer on a low setting to dry. Very helpful for new moms! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Trost

customer_reviews.title: Farm style sink? No problem!
customer_reviews.text: So so soft and nice! I have what they call a farm style sink so it’s huge, and doesn’t have a divider in the middle. Instead I found the perfect size square plastic container to put inside of my sink and to hold the bath petals at target for 4 dollars! It’s a white square plastic container that’s going to hold baby perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Ashcatash

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, a bit hard to use
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something for our newborn, that wasn't a hard plastic tub. This fit the bill, but bathtime with it is a 2 person job in my opinion. I put this in my kitchen sink, which is bigger and deeper then a bathroom sink, and the petals move, so you have to be REALLY careful that the baby's head doesn't slip between the petals and hit the sink. But it washes up easy, dries in a day. I have been throwing it in the wash and doing a spin cycle after using it. Then I hang it from the shower curtain rod, and it's good to go by the next day. I haven't had any problems with smell or construction.
customer_reviews.author: MrsMO

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use could possibly save your marriage.
customer_reviews.text: Best. Product. Ever. My husband and I was fighting about the other tub we have. Where to store it, how much water should be in it, how to keep the water in there warm... etc. This pad solved it all. Store this in the drying rack in the garage. Water just drains away. Use the kitchen tab and have running warm water. Now we will have some extra time till the kid outgrown the kitchen sink to figure things out. We can argue with clean kids now! Jk. My husband and I are doing great. Just super sleepy. Yay. Twins. Yay. Parenthood.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Lee

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't suggest to a friend
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this product, unfortunately it just didn't work out for us! The flower doesn't fit in my sink well, so I ended up laying it flat in the bathtub. The material gets cold quickly, so I had a difficult time keeping baby warm. Lastly, it's very bulky to hang in the bathtub to dry and takes a long time to dry completely.
customer_reviews.author: NicLJ

customer_reviews.title: So Cuteeeee
customer_reviews.text: SO CUTEEEE. It works as well as any other baby bath. You do have to wring it out before air drying or using a dryer. It's cute so it looks like a decoration! They could make this perfect if they added something grippy on the bottom. I just position my son so he rests on one petal and hold that&him from behind the petal. Still love it and worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Sutton

customer_reviews.title: "Favorite shower gift"
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a shower gift after looking up "favorite baby shower gifts". Everyone loved it especially the new mom. It was a unique gift as no one had seen one before and everyone went crazy over it. Since using it, she says it is her favorite and most useful gift. I will be giving this as my baby shower gift from now on!
customer_reviews.author: CJW

customer_reviews.title: Great product but...
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly fits my bathroom sink. Perfect way to wash my newborn. He loves it and is much calmer in the bloom than a bath sling. Lost a star because it does not hang dry thoroughly and takes two cycles in the dryer to dryer completely. Very hard to wring out so it drips when you carry it from one spot to the next. Very soft fabric and the petals perfectly support babys head. He doesnt slide down too much which was an issue with the regular bath sling. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Baby luxury and comforting spa experience
customer_reviews.text: Love the blooming bath lotus! We just had our second child and still had the infant tub from our first child but the newborn sling had disintegrated since then and had to be thrown away. We used drying mats to position baby but baby would slide down and we were worried she would slip beneath the water. The structure of the lotus really helps secure her in place and is soft and plush, making bath time comfy and the water from the tub spout would not go directly on baby’s head. Bath time was a less stressful experience for me and a little spa experience for baby. Strongly recommend to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Toguchi (Kashiwabara)

customer_reviews.title: Not convenient for a newborn
customer_reviews.text: This might be fine for older babies but this was not good for a newborn. I had to hold her up with one hand the whole time and the rest of the time try to manage the water while washing her. The lotus covers the drain in the sink so you can’t leave the water running or it fills all the way up, and you can’t drain while the baby is in there so you can rinse the baby because you’re holding the baby and can’t get your other hand down to the drain. Just was a huge hassle. I bought a 20 dollar tub from Walmart after buying this so I can wash my baby easier.
customer_reviews.author: tiffany donk

customer_reviews.title: Too small for farm sink, too big for many bathroom sinks
customer_reviews.text: I like that we can use this in our bathroom sink so we don’t have to do the dreaded lean over the bathtub. But it only works in one bathroom of our house bc of the size. It is too large for a small or even standard bathroom sink in my opinion. Also too small for our farm sink in the kitchen. It also gets a mildew smell after a bath or two so I do have to machine wash it more often that I would like. But it’s worth it to us bc we don’t have to use the tub or any tub inserts that break the back.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: 17 week old son loves it. He prefers to be able to move around in the bath and this allows him to sit up or recline. The tub we have isn’t the best for that. This is way easier to use than I thought it would be. Wringing our the water isn’t real easy, but then I toss it in the dryer for a bit.
customer_reviews.author: KA

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I recieved this a gift for my baby shower a d I love it. It works great in my kitchen sink after I'm done using it I hang it in my shower to dry I haven't had any problems with mold or mildew. I bought a couple of these to keep on hand for baby gifts. I would hight reccomend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna from NE

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: After spending a lot of money on not-good baby items I am trying to help out other expectant or new parents. The second this gets wet, it also gets cold, which you can imagine is not comfortable for a baby. You also have to put it in the dryer immediately so it doesn't smell or turn moldy which is an extra step that as a parent I did not want to deal with. Now, it's only use is as a knee pad outside the bathtub when we kneel down. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Carlee Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Cushy & Easy
customer_reviews.text: I love this!! I use it with my grandson who is 7 months. It’s really designed for younger babies, but my grandson is small and the flower is so cushy. It’s easy to use, stick it in the sink, when done hang it above the laundry room sink & ready for the next time. I think mike dries within a day, but I don’t give him a bath every time, he parents do.
customer_reviews.author: ShopSmart

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, life saver
customer_reviews.text: I love this bath! My first child I used a standard bath that you place in the tub and it killed my back. This is so easy. I was worried my sink would be too small as I live in an older house when sinks were tiny. But fits and works great! My baby loves it. My back loves it. Get this, you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Heaven

customer_reviews.title: It does it’s purpose
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect to use in the sink so I don’t have to bend over in the bathtub. It is super fast. Because I don’t have a dryer it takes long to dry but I just hang it up. I also use it in the bath but I like it better for the sink. Super cute but a little expensive to me.
customer_reviews.author: boriquaa1130

customer_reviews.title: Worth it! No more screaming.
customer_reviews.text: The first 2 baths we gave our son was a regular sink bath with a towel in the bottom. Holding our less than month old was a little difficult and he was upset the entire time. I bought the blooming bath and used it last night, it was easier to bath him because it provided more traction, made the space smaller and allowed some water to pool in the bottom which kept him so much calmer. He barely whined! Totally worth it! As he gets older we plan to continue to use it. I prefer giving our baby baths in the sink so we aren’t breaking our backs leaning over the tub. This is a game changer
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Does as needed.
customer_reviews.text: We needed the sink for our baby to be padded and it does just that. Once baby is done we just let hot water run it through to remove any loose floating things, ring it out and hang in the shower and it dries off in a decent time. Haven’t had any odor or difficulties with this product. Plus it’s really cute.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Mauga

customer_reviews.title: Too big and gets cold fast
customer_reviews.text: HAd high expectations for this. Was let down. Not good for infants as you have to hold them up the entire time and the petals get cold very easily because hold the water in them but are out in open air. Ended up throwing this in the closet and bought the baby bath whale from target. Maybe might be useful once she gets bigger
customer_reviews.author: Angel & Desiree Mercado

customer_reviews.title: Gotta wash after every 2 baths or it smells.
customer_reviews.text: I love this blooming bath lotus and my son loves it too. Been using it for him since he was 3 weeks. I throw it in the dryer after each use but I wash it after every 2 uses because it gets a funky smell to it. It’s really light and does a good job with cushioning him so the edges of the sink doesn’t hurt him.
customer_reviews.author: BOyMoM2

customer_reviews.title: Did not love it as much as I thought I would
customer_reviews.text: This baby bath works exactly as advertised & is easy to machine wash. I just didn't love using it. There was such a small window of time where it was really useful I'm not sure it justifies the $40 price tag. My baby quickly outgrew it. I had a 3 in 1 tub for my first baby, will go back to something like that for baby #3.
customer_reviews.author: Tony88

customer_reviews.title: Must have for newborn
customer_reviews.text: A must have for washing a newborn. This bath pillow is amazing. We used a plastic tub for my first child and it was a pain every time we bathed him. We bought this to bath my daughter in the kitchen sink, bath time isn't a hassle anymore. It does hold a lot of water. We just ring it out in the sink, then hang it in the shower to air dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this product for quick, easy bath times. I used my big plastic baby bathtub once before I ditched it for this product. It Provides cushioned and warm support for my baby. He seems to really enjoy his baths. The kitchen sink was too big, because it’s a double farmhouse sink, but it fits perfectly in my bathroom sink. It would work in a standard kitchen sink. Hangs in the shower for easy drying.
customer_reviews.author: Ellis Others

customer_reviews.title: This bath flower is so much better. It seems like my baby loves it too ...
customer_reviews.text: This has made bath time so much easier. Leaning over our huge garden tub to give baths in the baby tub we bought was starting to kill my back. Plus the infant insert didn't really support my newborn that well. This bath flower is so much better. It seems like my baby loves it too and is really comfortable. After we just wring it out and toss it in the dryer on low.
customer_reviews.author: Diamond

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: Back pain after having the baby i needed something like this to help me so i don’t have to bend. But, this doesn’t fit well in My sink my daughter is sitting so straight up and can’t lean back, it’s hard to wash her, i couldn’t wash her hair, it’s really hard to get dry, it really doesn’t hold heat like i thought it would the pedals get cold real fast. I would rather bend down and wash her that way. I wouldn’t recommend this bath. I am going to look for other options.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Howard

customer_reviews.title: It fits perfectly in our sink and keeps our baby comfortable. He is six months now and we have ...
customer_reviews.text: This dries well, when put in the washer after wringing out. It doesn't mildew or smell. It fits perfectly in our sink and keeps our baby comfortable. He is six months now and we have used it since he was about theee months old. Still fits great. I have also use it for our two year old in the sink. We have three kids and I'm sad I bought this with the third and not sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Wilhelm

customer_reviews.title: This is a good product to use in the sink or baby bath
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product to use in the sink or baby bath, however you really need to have a dryer in your house/ apt . Air drying this product is not a good option because you can never wring it out enough, it takes days to dry and then you already have mildew growing in it. I went through two of these, I wish it was more air dry friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Monica P

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use bath option for newborn
customer_reviews.text: We are new born parents and got this as a gift. It has helped make bath time for our newborn easy in the kitchen sink. It is machine washable which we can attest to having washed it at least twice. Material remains soft even after washing.
customer_reviews.author: M. Chotimongkol

customer_reviews.title: Super cute and soft bathing insert for sink
customer_reviews.text: Super cute and soo soft! Can’t wait to use this for bathing our newborn once he is here. It was easy to launder to get it ready for baby. I haven’t used it yet in the sink but I feel like it is going to make bath time so much easier at the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: A. Tomlin

customer_reviews.title: Love this bath flower
customer_reviews.text: Love this bath flower! I've been using it for about 3 months, no issues. Every so many baths I throw it in the washer. I found that this works better in shallow sinks for small babies, difficult to use in deep sinks when they are so little. I'm sure that once my baby gets bigger it wouldn't be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: jnetkathryn

customer_reviews.title: Cute but awkward
customer_reviews.text: It’s cute but a little awkward for a newborn. It’s also bulky and hard to wring out. Drips all the way to the bathroom. I miss the traditional baby bathtub for my newborn but this will probably work better when he can sit up by himself.
customer_reviews.author: D. S. Kielman

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this purchase initially, but three baths in and I really like it. It’s very comfortable for our LO and so far he has yet to cry during a bath. Worst part is squeezing out the water at the end, but to clean I just throw it in the washer and it comes slightly damp like the rest of the laundry and goes in the dryer no problem. I’m not sure how useful it will be as our LO grows, but it’s great for our 1 month old.
customer_reviews.author: Yes ma'am

customer_reviews.title: Soft
customer_reviews.text: Love this!! My son loved it!! His first bath was horrible but ever since he got over the initial shock of being in water, he loves this bath. He did poop on it so I had to wash it a few times but it washes well. The only annoyance is drying it, but I can just hang it on the shower head until it dries. New babies don't need a bath but every 3-4 days, anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Destini Duckett

customer_reviews.title: So cute and practical
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew who is now 2 weeks old. My sister-in-law was able to give him a bath in this last night and reported back to me that instead of screaming his head off like he usually does at bath time he was so calm and actually enjoyed his bath!!! Happy momma, happy baby, happy auntie!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for smaller babies and keeping them calm
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was six pounds 14 oz and this is much better for her than the plastic tub with the sling. As she gets bigger the tub will be fine but for right now having the soft flower bath makes bath time so much calmer. I actually just place it on the plastic tub I have and let her recline back.
customer_reviews.author: jasminejm

customer_reviews.title: My go to baby shower gift
customer_reviews.text: It’s soft, beautiful and fits great in any sink. No more baby sliding around in a cold hard sink. It keeps baby secure, snuggled up and warm, and then keeps them secure when they’re ready for the bathtub. Washes and drys beautifully. I never wonder what gift to get for a new baby, this is it........
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Single best baby purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Single best purchase I made for my infant! It's soft and creates a safe bathing experience. It's easy to dry and clean as well, just pop it in the washer and dryer. I absolutely love it! Don't hesitate...buy this, it's fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: BellaBabyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We used this for our preemie baby. He loves the bath but this allows me to bathe him on my own and he is very safe. We have a great set up for this. I have a small sink in my guest bathroom and an extra shower. So I hang it in that shower to dry. If you don’t have a set up like this be aware that this thing holds a ton of water and takes forever to air dry. I would say it takes 48 hours after I wring it out for it to be completely dry. Regardless my son loves it and it makes bath time so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gentle Bath
customer_reviews.text: Other than the fact my little newborn was such a wiggle worm and would slide down in her vaththis is a great product. It is gentle all the way around so I never had to worry about our little one getting hurt in her bath. Only downfall was it takes forever to dry if you're not washing and drying it after each use. Otherwise I recommend this product completely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LIFE SAVER - BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.text: We use this for my nephew and its so amazing!!! At first we put towels down so he wouldn't slide around but you can imagine how that went. This is the best invention ever and it is so super soft and comfortable while he takes his bath. We have used this in the kitchen sink and also the bath tub and it works perfectly for both.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Maybe my son was too young when we tried to ...
customer_reviews.text: Maybe my son was too young when we tried to use this but since he couldn't sit up on his own it was awkward and uncomfortable for us both and returned. Might try again later when he's a little older
customer_reviews.author: A. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Be careful washing it
customer_reviews.text: We loved this product at first. It's super cute and is a very comfortable way to sink wash baby. However after about a month of hang drying the edges began to yellow. We washed it as instructions stated and it came out torn in several places. Feel like we wasted our money as little as we were able to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany McBride

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Favorite baby product I bought for baby #4! Wish I had these with my other 3! Made bath time so much more comfortable and convenient. Definitely easier to bathe him and he loves baths! I've not had a baby enjoy it as much as he does and I believe the flower helps that a ton!
customer_reviews.author: My4Sons

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, fits any sink, and easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: This product is so much more comfortable for our 4 month old. She loves sitting in it and is sad when bath time is is over! This design literally can fit into any sink too so you’re not forced to do bath time in the big kitchen sink. We just fold one of the petals down to fit it under the faucet of our tiny bathroom sink. It also has a strap on the back so we just hook it to the bathtub faucet and let it drip dry when we’re done.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: My grand daughter loves bathtime!
customer_reviews.text: Where were these years ago??? Lucky to have them for my grand baby - she loves her bath time in the sink! This is a great little item that keeps them from sliding around in the sink and can later be used in the tub!
customer_reviews.author: S. Modrall

customer_reviews.title: Best way to clean your baby
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a baby shower gift .She was very excited to receive it it the mail.Came very quick ,so far she’s loving it for her baby . Good packing ,suctions well ,easy to clean .The best way to clean your baby ever!❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
